Following the tutorial, this apt command fails to locate package `\` because the sed command didn’t successfully remove the slash.

I'm using `bionic` and I called `dependencies.sh` with `GAZEBO_MAJOR_VERSION=9`

Here's the difference in the output of `sed` that this PR makes.

    $ sed 's:\\::g' <<< $BASE_DEPENDENCIES                                     
    build-essential 
                       cmake           
                       debhelper       
                       mesa-utils      
                       cppcheck        
                       xsltproc        
                       python-lxml     
                       python-psutil   
                       python          
                       bc              
                       netcat-openbsd  
                       gnupg2          
                       net-tools       
                       locales
    developer@3fc648789b15:~$ sed 's:\\ ::g' <<< $BASE_DEPENDENCIES
    build-essential \
                       cmake           \
                       debhelper       \
                       mesa-utils      \
                       cppcheck        \
                       xsltproc        \
                       python-lxml     \
                       python-psutil   \
                       python          \
                       bc              \
                       netcat-openbsd  \
                       gnupg2          \
                       net-tools       \
                       locales
